project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-782].
  {panel}

Lot's of people, like us, need issue locking, even before Service Desk was created. And every time, this wasn't important enough.
Now with Service desk, this is ESSENTIAL! 
Even with the Who's looking plugin, time is lost because hard working people try to solve the same issues, as fast as they can. Collision is inevitable.
So please, make this a priority.
The same goes for setting different default Viewable by, groups. Essential when you need to keep comments internal.

jan
fields.summary: need for Issue locking, now more than ever

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-774].
  {panel}

On a Win8 machine on FF (32.0)

- Login into customer portal
- On the profile page, click on 'Change your password'
- Submit the dialog with invalid inputs

Expected result:
Client side validation must be in place, informing users of invalid input.

Actual result:
Dialog closes, and the request fails as server sends a error-response.
fields.summary: 'Change your password' dialog's client side validation fails on FF on Win8

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-773].
  {panel}

JIRA Service Desk notification triggers for a reporter are

- Issue comment event when the comment is not by reporter
- Issue status change

But, there seem to be a failure, when JIRA issue's assignee is changed by inline editing the Assignee.

Notification email sends the same message that was sent last when triggered by the above event.

This is against JIRA Version  - 6.4-OD-04-006
fields.summary: JSD triggers a notification for the reporter on Issue Assigned event

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
* Import an issue into JIRA Service Desk project (probably via CSV) whose create date makes it more than 5 years old.
* Configure SLA goals for the Service Desk using custom calendars, such that the SLA (e.g. time to resolution) for the specific issue has already exceeded 5 years
* Save you configuration, for the system to calculate SLAs.

*Expected result*
* The SLA calculation accurately indicates for how long an Issue has been tracked (e.g. how long since it was created, or how long it's been pending resolution) in hours.

*Actual result*
* For all issues that have exceeded 5 years on the queue, the total number of hours for which the issue has been tracked seems to default approximately to a fixed value.
fields.summary: SLA calculation based on custom calendar breaks for issues over 5 years old

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-764].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a JIRA Service Desk has a linked Confluence space as a knowledge base, users can search for articles within the space using the search bar.

However, in the case that the user either A) doesn't have anything in particular they want to search for or B) simply wants to read the documentation for the product, then this search bar isn't useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a link either to display all FAQs or the documentation directly to the linked Confluence space. It could be a button in the portal, or a request that will pop-up a list when clicked.
fields.summary: Provide a link directly to the Confluence Knowledge base article in Customer Portal

For example:

25 to breach
5 minutes since breach

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-754].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

The existing documentation on the JQL used for the Service Desk option is not clear, as in the examples below:

- Tickets Created
- Tickets Resolved
- Time to Resolution - Breached
- Time to Resolution - Succeeded

h3. Expected behaviour

Create/Improve an existing document to clearly show which JQL's are used for each filter.
fields.summary: Improve documentation on pre defined JQL filters from Service Desk

fields.description:
Once a request type is deleted from a Service Desk project, the existing issue that was created under that request type will break. 

The issue is still viewable from the Service Desk request view, but all of the issue details will be missing:
!scshot1.png|thumbnail!

Although it seems that it's possible to add a comment to the broken request, the operation will fail with the spinner spinning non stop. But once the issue is refreshed, the comment is successfully added.
fields.summary: When a request type is deleted, the existing issues that were created under that request type will break

fields.description:
h4. Experienced Behavior:

Issues moved to a JIRA Service Desk project do not show SLA information when the SLA would be in a stopped state after the issue is moved.
* SLA does show when it would be in a paused or started/running after the issue is moved.

The SLA will appear if there is a start condition that allows the SLA to restart and, after the move, an action is taken that meets this condition. In this situation the SLA appears and begins to count down as expected however the first SLA cycle icon does not appear.

h4. Expected Behavior:

SLA value is calculated and displayed for all issues moved to Service Desk project regardless of SLA state after the move.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
* Create two projects, one of which is a Service Desk
* Create issue in non service desk project
* Take an action on the issue that would meet Service Desk stop condition
* Move issue to service desk project
* The SLA does not appear when viewing the issue

h4. Use Case Example:

"We have a project that is NOT using Jira Service Desk (JSD). If we "work" on it, assign it, comment on it, etc and then move it to a project that is using JSD, the time to first response SLA is not displayed."
fields.summary: SLA not appearing on issues moved to Service Desk project

Hello!
After installing "Service Desk" I created project with a role "Service Desk Customers". After this i wrote a plugin which is trying to find user's project roles using JIRA API.
The problem is that for users with this role plugin can not find this role. As a result, I need to do some administrative or programmatic workarounds.
Hope you can help me.
Thanks in advance, Andrey.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
* Set user language different from the system default language
* Open the customer portal main page
* Login page is displayed in system default language
* Login to customer portal
* Customer portal is displayed in system default language
* Refresh the page, portal displayed in user language
* Logout from CP, login page is in user language
* Refresh the page, it turns into default language
fields.summary: Customer Portal is not displayed in user preferred language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-727].
  {panel}

Sorry, but support site does not work.

You have some bug in design.
Lets detail your object:
Queues - some object for team work. Like agile board. "One window" for real time monitoring. How monitor 50 PROJECT in one browser tab??
SLA - individual for PROJECT
Reports - individual for PROJECT
Customer portal - individual for PROJECT
People - individual for PROJECT

As we see you must move current "Queues" from PROJECT to individual object.

Real life situaion
We have teams:
- IT
- VOIP
- Developers
and others
And about 50+ customers (PORJECTS)

Every customers have different SLA
But IT team must see many Project Queues to monitor situatiion. By filter i can divide issues to teams by params. 
IT team must see IT TEAM QUEUES for all projects in system.
fields.summary: As agent of some team i want see all projects in one "team queues"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-724].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:

Define an SLA with a goal of 1 minute for all issues in a project. The conditions should be Created Issue until Reporter added Comment

Create 4 issues:
 1. New Feature, and immediately add a comment so the SLA is achieved
 2. Bug, and immediately add a comment  so the SLA is achieved
 3. New Feature with no comment so the SLA is breached
 4. Bug with a comment so the SLA is breached

Wait a minute until issues 3 and 4 breach their SLA.

Now change the SLA to add a condition to the goal: issuetype = "New Feature", save it and note the message from SD that issues will be reindexed.

Expected:

The SLA should now only appear on New Feature issues (1 and 3), not on Bugs (2 and 4)

Actual:

The SLA appears in issues 1, 2 and 3. That is, issues with achieved SLAs such as issue 2 are not updated as expected when the SLA is changed. However issues that breached or failed an SLA are updated (as expected).

This current behavior could also be usefully noted in the Usage section of https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/SLAs
fields.summary: Achieved SLAs are not updated when an SLA is changed, but breached ones are

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-722].
  {panel}

Product managers that write user stories and feature requests in JIRA often use support requests to understand customer needs. It'd be good to compile the service desk requests that relate to specific features/stories.

Ideas:
* Applinks type functionality linking between service desk and JIRA
* A description field for the link with a quick summary of what's the customer need
* Some notification connection to keep customers aware through service desk around the progress of the feature (including links to release notes, etc). This could either be through their existing ticket or perhaps on a dashboard that shows their open feature requests.
fields.summary: As a product manager I'd like to understand use-cases for feature requests that come through support

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-721].
  {panel}

When using Service Desk for support, something that comes up regularly is the need to track bug impact. It would be good to summarize the impact of bugs on support ticket volume.

A few ideas:
* A report showing trends (overall, last month, etc) for tickets created by certain bugs
* Applink type functionality to other instances of JIRA for bug tracking, with links to all the service desk requests for bugs so you can view the support tickets from the bug report
* Workflow triggering for Service Desk requests to notify customers when bugs are resolved
fields.summary: As a product manager, I would like to know the number of support tickets caused by bugs in my products

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-717].
  {panel}

In case we try to rename the service desk roles below, JIRA will recreate them with the original name. We'd like to be able to rename those roles in order to fit with our organisational needs.

* Service Desk Customers
* Service Desk Team

Thanks!

Cathy
fields.summary: We'd like to rename the service desk roles

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA and JIRA Service Desk
# set the Default Language in the General Configuration as French or German
# create a new user(eg:usera) used different preferable language . Eg: English
# login as usera into Service Desk
# (BUG) the My Request will not use English. please refer to screencast sds2 for reference.
# refresh the page and the My Request will used English


Browser tested: Chrome and Firefox
Environment tested: JIRA 6.2.5 and JIRA Service Desk 1.2.6.1 so far
fields.summary: Page was not translated immediately after login

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-710].
  {panel}

If the System Language in JIRA is set to German, trying to create a project from Service Desk (ie from the Service Desk dropdown > Create new Service Desk) will fail.

It will fail with one of the two following messages:
{quote}
There was a problem creating Queue configurations for this new Service Desk{quote}

or if you switch the language to English, then back to German. No error will be displayed, your project will be created, but the creation box won't be dismissed properly.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Screenshots are attached and below are the steps to reproduce.
I recently found bug with Service Desk, specifically the SLA calculation of cloned tickets.

When a ticket is cloned the start time of the SLA is carried over. Note: this happens for Change Assignee and Status: Work In Progress, but not Created.

Below I have taken screen shots of the issue. 

1)	I create an issue 
2)	There are 2 SLAs  that start when the Assignee is Changed as well when the issues is moved to Work in Progress (in my case I have them both start at 10:36am on 8/11/14)
3)	Both SLAs end when I mark the issue as done:
4)	Next I clone the issue and you can see both SLAs have started even though the issue has neither changed the Assignee nor is it in Work in Progress
5)	Note the “Time to first response” SLA does not carry over the created date of the original issue, however the other SLAs have a start time of 10:36am when the CLONED issue was created after that (10:40am).

Fix: Please do not have the start time for change of Assignee or change of Status carry over to a cloned issue.
fields.summary: Service Desk, specifically the SLA calculation of cloned tickets

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-704].
  {panel}

Dear Sir/Madam,
in our Jira (version 5.1.8) we have plugin Vertygo SLA (version 6.5.3.0; our licence number is SEN-2456349).

We created issue in https://jira.valiantys.com/browse/VSLA-1219, but it won't be fix by Valiantys. Would you fix it (or even it isn't work incorrect) in Jira Service Desk?

This is description of the problem:
We observed some bug in calculation of due date.
Below is the scenario for getting this incorrect behaviour:
1. We have registered issue (for example 1.08.2014) with Start SLA in the future, for example today: 11.08.2014
2. This issue has Time SLA which should start calculating today 11.08.2014, but work is in progress from 1.08.2014.
3. From 1.08.2014 this clock was frozen for 10 hours (for example in 5-6.08.2014).
4. When Time SLA starts today, it has "-10h" in "Consumed time", which ist't correct, because it should start today and it shouldn't take into account the time when clock was frozen.
When Consumed time is calculate as negative, Due date is also incorrect.

Please let us know whether this problem occurs in Jira Service Desk and if it'll be fix.

Best regards, 
Malgorzata Mroz
fields.summary: Problem with calculating due date - Vertygo SLA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

After investigating this request further, we believe it has been incorrectly categorised as a feature suggestion rather than a bug. Jira Service Management notifications are currently not respecting the [global Jira setting for ‘email from’|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-application-options-938847824.html#ConfiguringJiraapplicationoptions-settingsGeneralsettings].

We understand that this issue can cause confusion for your customers and it is an issue we would like to resolve. Thank you for your votes and comments on this ticket, it has surfaced it for our attention.

The related public bug ticket ([JSDSERVER-3597|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3597]) will be reopened and triaged accordingly - please follow progress on that ticket.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 17th Sep 2018}
Hi All,

Firstly, thanks for your feedback, passion, and advocacy for this suggestion. Please accept my apologies for allowing this issue to remain open for some time without clear direction from Atlassian.

We're always working hard to improve Jira Service Desk for every user, by balancing the short and long-term needs of our customers. In this instance, we’re exploring the right approach to address this fix and would continue to gather interest as we come up with an approach that works for the majority of our customers.

Please watch the ticket for any future updates.  

Thank you,
 The Jira Service Desk Team
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-702].
{panel}
Currently, JIRA Service Desk's *From* field in its email notifications shows the user's Full Name (Display Name):
|!From.png!|

This is hard-coded in JIRA Service Desk on {{ServiceDeskEmailImpl.scala}}. As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to have this following the *Email from* configuration of JIRA's [*General Configuration*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options].

Currently, this format can cause confusion for users, as it is not clear that replying to the email will send the reply to JIRA - as it shows the user's name, the user may think he's replying to the sender's email directly.
fields.summary: Use Jira's 'Email From' configuration in Jira Service Desk Notifications

fields.description:
We have disabled Service Desk notifications and have elected to use a third-party plugin (JETI) for all email notifications. To make it work according to our needs, we ask our users to update their profile settings to set the "My Changes" preference to "Notify me". This page is accessible be default to users via the following URL:

https://domain.com/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa

When users view that page, the right hand has the Activity Stream widget by default. However, when a user in the Service Desk Customers role visits the page it displays an exception (see screenshot).

I've not found a way to disable the activity stream on this page and this seems like a bug, at least to me, in that if the user doesn't have permission the Activity Stream widget should handle that condition more gracefully.
fields.summary: Exception thrown in activity viewer widget for Service Desk Customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-691].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new metric for SLA through a Custom Select List (Cascading) field. 
!sla_2.jpg|thumbnail!
!sla_1.jpg|thumbnail!
# Create a new ticket which is subjected to SLA
!sla_3.jpg|thumbnail!
# As expected, it should show up the SLA on the right corner
!sla_4.jpg|thumbnail!
# Resolve the ticket
!sla_5.jpg|thumbnail!
# After the ticket has been resolved, *Edit* the ticket and change it to a Non- SLA metric
!sla_6.jpg|thumbnail!

Result:
It is still showing the SLA on the right corner, though it has been modified to a non SLA metric.
!sla_7.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected Behaviour:
Even the ticket has already been resolved and yet modified to a non SLA metric, it should respect the JQL and the SLA should not display.
fields.summary: SLA still showing up when issue has been modified to a Non-SLA value after Closing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a new Service Desk request, and assigning this new request to the same user, you will receive one notification for each event. If you add a comment on the customer portal, you will receive one notification.

However if you open this request in the Issue Navigator, and add a comment to this issue with the Reporter/Assignee as the same user, this user will receive two Notifications from this event.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new Service Desk.
# Use the Default notification Scheme for this Service Desk Project.
# Login with a different user and create a new request on the Customer Portal.
# Assign this request to the same user, having the Reporter/Assignee as the same user.
# Add a comment through the Customer Portal, the user will receive only one notification.
# Add a comment through the Issue Navigator, the user will receive Duplicate notifications.

h3. Expected results
The user should receive a single notification.

h3. Actual Results
The user will receive duplicated notifications.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Duplicate notification when Reporter and Assignee are the same user.

fields.description:
Renaming the status, using the default Service Desk Workflow, doesn't display the modified status name. 

Steps to reproduce
# For example, originally, the status name is "Waiting for Support". Let say we rename it to "Support in Progress"
!bug_3.jpg|thumbnail!
# The customer raise a service desk request via portal
!bug_1.jpg|thumbnail!
# Upon submitting the ticket, the status should be "Support in Progress" as modified form the workflow, but it is still showing the old status. But showing the correct one when you open the ticket from JIRA.
!bug_2.jpg|thumbnail!
!bug_4.jpg|thumbnail!
# Checking from the customer's email who created the ticket, it is still showing the old status.
!customer_mail.jpg|thumbnail!
# Checking the support agent's email, it is showing the correct renamed status which is "Support in Progress"
!agent_mail.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected behaviour:
Once the status has been renamed, it should be displayed on the portal and mail notification correctly.
fields.summary: Renaming a Status is not reflecting in Mail Notification and Portal

Within a Service Desk Queue sorting by a field name does not appear to work correctly.  Ancedotal evidence is that is overwritted by the default Key Sort.   An example of the code for Show Issues is ORDER BY "Client Name (realtime)" desc.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a user navigates to {{Service Desk >> Queues}}, the page takes more than 10 seconds to load. This usually happens after JIRA has been restarted. The behaviour improves over time but still requires around 5 seconds to load the page. 

h4. Cause

* Each time when Service Desk is loaded, it runs pre-condition checks which check each request type and each field in the request type - [JSD-502|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-502]
* Queries for the pre-condition check are not optimised.
fields.summary: Loading Queues page takes a long time

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-668].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Issue

When the SLAs are set in such a way that there will be a clash between the condition and definition, the SLAs would not work properly

h3. Steps to reproduce

In the scenario that I met, this was the following situation :

# Set up the SLA for a certain Service Desk to be the following :
#* Stop on Resolution Set
#* SLA would no longer show up in the issue if the issue reached the Resolved status
!SLA1.png|thumbnail!
!SLA2.png|thumbnail!
# Resolve a ticket within that Service Desk, so that the SLAs would no longer show :
!SLA3.png|thumbnail!
# Reopen the ticket. The SLA should now show, but is no longer showing :
!SLA4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLAs will not work properly if there is a clash between the conditions and definitions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

Our environment is as below:
Jira: 6.1.3
Confluence: 5.3.4
ServiceDesk:1.2.6.1
fields.summary: Jira servicedesk knowledge base displaying a blank page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-659].
  {panel}

h5.summary
In Customer Portal, all fields of the "Labels" type will get suggestions from the default _Labels_ field.

h5.steps to reproduce
# create a Custom Field of the "Labels" type;
# add the new field to a Customer Portal form;
# create an issue (either in Customer Portal or base JIRA):
#* populate the custom label field;
#* populate the default _Labels_ field with different values.
# attempt to create a new issue in Customer Portal and see suggestions available for both fields.

*Expected result:* suggestions match existing values for each field.
*Actual result:* all suggestions are existing values for the default _Labels_ field.

This only affects the Customer Portal forms, in JIRA views fields are behaving as expected.

h5.workaround
# Update the labels manually in JIRA Issue View.
# Create a dummy issue and maintain the list of values to be suggested in its default _Labels_ field.
fields.summary: Incorrect suggestions for labels fields in Customer Request form
